Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Drug or Chemical by Structure/Organic Chemical/Nucleic Acids, Nucleosides, and Nucleotides/Nucleic Acids/DNA/Cloning Vector/Viral Vector/Pox Virus Vector/Canarypox Vector
Record.BroaderTerm: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Description: Any of the genetically engineered live canarypox vectors with application in anti-cancer therapy. Canarypox vectors retain the pancytotropism of most poxviruses, but is unable to productively replicate in non-avian species, thus eliminating the safety concerns exist with other vectors. Canarypox viral vector is designed to carry a gene of interest into a eukaryotic cell where the gene of interest can be expressed subsequently.
